alert.note: Alert for Portage; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 10:57PM CDT until October 29 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wisconsin, including the following counties, Portage and Wood. * WHEN...Until 500 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1055 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain continuing. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inch are expected over the area overnight. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stevens Point, Wisconsin Rapids, Marshfield, Whiting, Amherst, Pittsville, Lake Wazeecha, Babcock, Plover, Stockton, Nekoosa, Port Edwards, Biron, Hewitt, Sherry, Auburndale, Jordan, Vesper, Rosholt and Park Ridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
